metadata.title: CVE-2021-47439 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:dsa: microchip: Added the condition for scheduling ksz_mib_read_work Whenthe ksz module is installed and removed using rmmod, kernel crashes withnull pointer dereferrence error. During rmmod, ksz_switch_remove functiontries to cancel the mib_read_workqueue using cancel_delayed_work_syncroutine and unregister switch from dsa. During dsa_unregister_switch itcalls ksz_mac_link_down, which in turn reschedules the workqueue sincemib_interval is non-zero. Due to which queue executed after mib_intervaland it tries to access dp->slave. But the slave is unregistered in theksz_switch_remove function. Hence kernel crashes. To avoid this crash,before canceling the workqueue, resetted the mib_interval to 0. v1 -> v2:-Removed the if condition in ksz_mib_read_work

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
